Question_1.Context: The study investigated the nutrient components of host plant species and their effects on the susceptibility of H. cunea larvae to HycuNPV. It specifically looked at the survival rates, survival times, food intake, and body size of infected larvae fed on different host plant leaves.
Question_1.Question: What factor was positively correlated with the nitrogen components of host plant leaves in relation to the survival rates and body size of H. cunea larvae infected with HycuNPV?
Question_1.Source: The nitrogen content in host plant leaves was significantly and positively correlated with the survival rate, survival time, dry weight gain, food intake, and relative growth rate of HycuNPV-infected larvae.

Question_2.Context: The study explored the effects of different host plants on the feeding behavior of H. cunea larvae infected with HycuNPV. It analyzed parameters such as dry weight gain, food amount, relative consumption rate, relative growth rate, and efficiency of converting ingested and digested food into body matter.
Question_2.Question: Which parameter significantly decreased in H. cunea larvae after HycuNPV infection?
Question_2.Source: The dry weight gain, food amount, relative growth rate, efficiency of converting ingested food, and efficiency of conversion of digested food of larvae significantly decreased after HycuNPV infection.

Question_3.Context: The study investigated the enzyme responses of H. cunea larvae infected with HycuNPV on different host plants. It analyzed the activities of catalase (CAT), peroxidase (POD), superoxide dismutase (SOD), and prophenoloxidase (PPO) enzymes.
Question_3.Question: Which enzyme activity was significantly higher in HycuNPV-infected larvae feeding on poplar leaves compared to other host plants?
Question_3.Source: The larvae feeding on poplar leaves exhibited the highest POD enzyme activity among the uninfected larvae, significantly higher than those feeding on other host plants.

Question_4.Context: The study examined the carbon and nitrogen content of different host plants and their impact on the susceptibility of H. cunea larvae to HycuNPV. It highlighted the variations in carbon content, nitrogen content, and carbon-to-nitrogen ratio among the host plants.
Question_4.Question: Which host plant had the highest nitrogen content compared to the other host plants?
Question_4.Source: The P. deltoides leaves had the highest nitrogen content compared to the other host plant leaves.

Question_5.Context: The study conducted a correlation analysis between the biological parameters of H. cunea larvae infected with HycuNPV and the nutrient components of host plants. It investigated the relationships between nitrogen content, carbon content, and carbon-to-nitrogen ratio of host plants with various biological parameters of infected larvae.
Question_5.Question: What was negatively correlated with the survival rate, survival time, dry weight gain, food intake, and relative growth rate of HycuNPV-infected larvae?
Question_5.Source: The carbon-to-nitrogen ratio in plants was negatively correlated with the survival rate, survival time, dry weight gain, food intake, and relative growth rate of larvae.

Question_6.Context: The study focused on the effects of different host plants on the enzyme activities of H. cunea larvae infected with HycuNPV. It examined the activities of catalase (CAT), peroxidase (POD), superoxide dismutase (SOD), and prophenoloxidase (PPO) enzymes.
Question_6.Question: Which enzyme activity was significantly lower in HycuNPV-infected larvae compared to uninfected larvae feeding on poplar leaves?
Question_6.Source: The infected larvae significantly decreased the POD activity, and the larvae feeding on poplar leaves exhibited the highest POD enzyme activity among the uninfected larvae.

Question_7.Context: The study explored the relationship between the nitrogen content in host plant leaves and the biological parameters of H. cunea larvae infected with HycuNPV. It highlighted the positive correlation between nitrogen content and various survival and growth-related parameters of infected larvae.
Question_7.Question: Which parameter was positively correlated with the nitrogen content in host plant leaves in relation to the survival rate and body size of H. cunea larvae infected with HycuNPV?
Question_7.Source: The nitrogen content in host plant leaves was significantly and positively correlated with the survival rate, survival time, dry weight gain, food intake, and relative growth rate of HycuNPV-infected larvae.
